Question
========

A and B are two events in a chance experiment. The probability of A and the probability of B are positive. If it is given that A and B are mutually are mutually exclusive, then

Answerlist
----------

* A and B are necessarily independent.
* Are A and B necessarily dependent (i.e., not independent).
* It cannot yet be said whether A and B are independent or not.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A and B are necessarily independent...: Incorrect
* Are A and B necessarily dependent (that is, not independent)...: Correct
* It cannot yet be said whether A and B are independent or not...: Incorrect
